Yes, there are several other things you can do to keep your horse healthy and prevent the spread of illnesses:

1. Proper nutrition: Make sure your horse is on a balanced diet that meets their nutritional needs. This will help boost their immune system and overall health.

2. Regular exercise: Exercise is important to keep your horse in good shape and maintain their overall health.

3. Regular horse care: Routine care such as grooming, providing clean bedding and living areas, and cleaning water buckets or troughs can help prevent the spread of bacteria and viruses.

4. Vaccinations: Work with your veterinarian to establish an appropriate vaccination schedule to protect your horse against common diseases.

5. Quarantine: If you're introducing a new horse to your herd, it's a good idea to quarantine them for a period of time to prevent the spread of any potential illnesses.

By following these tips and working closely with your veterinarian, you can help keep your horse healthy and happy.
